intro: Thapsus nigrum, commonly known as black thapsus, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its dark purple to black stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Thapsus nigrum is known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
